article.description: Elijah Bryant and Yoeli Childs combined to score 46 points and BYU bounced back from an upset loss at Pacific to keep Pepperdine winless in West Coast Conference play with an 83-63 win on Thursday night.
article.headline: Bryant, Childs spark 2nd half BYU rout of Pepperdine, 83-63
article.linkText: Bryant, Childs spark 2nd half BYU rout of Pepperdine, 83-63
article.story: PROVO, Utah -- Elijah Bryant and Yoeli Childs combined to score 46 points and BYU bounced back from an upset loss at Pacific to keep Pepperdine winless in West Coast Conference play with an 83-63 win on Thursday night. The Cougars led by just six at intermission, 40-34, but after Matthew Atewe's jumper to get the Waves within four, Bryant keyed a 15-2 run by knocking down three 3-pointers and adding two free throws. Bryant, who matched his season high with 29 points against Pacific, finished with 25 points on 8-of-12 shooting, including 5 of 8 from distance. In his last two games the junior is 11 of 20 from beyond the 3-point arc. Childs, who finished with 21 points and 12 rebounds, blocked a shot, giving him 80 for his career and tying him with Corbin Kaufusi for 15th all-time at BYU (14-4, 3-2). Colbey Ross and Atewe finished with 16 and 15 points, respectively, to lead Pepperdine (3-14, 0-5).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
